008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch05_EdgesAndContours;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.Convolver;
014import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
015import ij.process.Blitter;
016import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
017import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
018import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This plugin implements an Unsharp Masking filter similar to Photoshop 
023 * without thresholds, using a "clean" (sufficiently large) Gaussian filter.
024 * This implementation uses built-in ImageJ functionality only.
025 * The original image is modified.
026 * See Sec. 5.6.2 (Prog. 5.1) of [1] for additional details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
030 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2014/03/16
035 * @version 2022/09/23 revised
036 * 
037 * @see GaussianKernel1D#makeGaussKernel1D(double)
038 */
039
040public class Unsharp_Masking_Filter implements PlugInFilter {
041        
042        /** Filter radius (sigma of Gaussian). */
043        public static double Radius = 1.0;
044        /** Amount of sharpening (1.0 = 100%). */
045        public static double Amount = 1.0; 
046
047        @Override
048        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
049                return DOES_8G + DOES_STACKS; 
050        }
051        
052        @Override
053        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
054                if (!getParameters()) {
055                        return;
056                }
057                        
058                FloatProcessor I = ip.convertToFloatProcessor();
059                
060                //create a blurred version of the original
061                ImageProcessor J = I.duplicate();
062                float[] H = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(Radius);
063                Convolver cv = new Convolver();
064                cv.setNormalize(true);
065                cv.convolve(J, H, 1, H.length);
066                cv.convolve(J, H, H.length, 1);
067
068                double a = Amount;
069                
070                I.multiply(1 + a);                                              // multiply the original image by (1+a)
071                J.multiply(a);                                                  // multiply the mask image by a
072                I.copyBits(J, 0, 0, Blitter.SUBTRACT);  // subtract the weighted mask from the original
073
074                //copy result back into original byte image
075                ip.insert(I.convertToByte(false), 0, 0);
076        }
077        
078        private boolean getParameters() {
079                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Unsharp Mask");
080                gd.addNumericField("Radius (\u03C3 = 0.1 ... 20)", Radius, 1);
081                gd.addNumericField("Amount (a = 1 ... 500%)", Amount * 100, 0);
082                
083                gd.showDialog();
084                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
085                        return false;
086                }
087                
088                //same limits as in Photoshop:
089                Radius = gd.getNextNumber();
090                if (Radius > 20) Radius = 20;
091                if (Radius < 0.1) Radius = 0.1;
092                Amount = gd.getNextNumber() / 100;
093                if (Amount > 5.0) Amount = 5.0;
094                if (Amount < 0.01) Amount = 0.01;
095                return true;
096        }
097
098}
